page.title: 01INTRODUCTIONS
page.content: The block is cut from N.W. to S.E. by the picturesque Valley of the River Churnet.It is well wooded, with Forrestry Commision plantations intermingled with the deciduous woods and pastures for grazing and hay.To the North East there is farming on a larger scale.It is a rural area containing the largest part of the parishes of Alton, Farley and Oakamoor and is administered by Staffs Moorlands District Council & Staffordshire County Council.Much of Farley and Alton is designated a Conservation Area.Tourism has become important with the growth of Alton Towers,leisure drives,the picnic area etc. There are no major roads but mainly narrow,winding lanes.Primary education is provided in the villages but for secondary education,most shopping and employment it is necessary to leave the area.
